headline: Ryan highlights middle-class issues in latest TV ad
author: Trevor Hubert
sentences: The ad, which is part of a previously announced $3.3 million television ad buy, shows Mr. Ryan highlighting the middle-class issues he has focused on during the campaign, such as tax cuts and job creation, which he feels has to be done by America’s political parties putting their issues aside.

Mr. Ryan is on the ballot with Morgan Harper, a Columbus-area consumer protection attorney, and Traci “TJ” Johnson, a Columbus-area information technology executive, in the May 3 primary for the Democratic nomination.
U.S. Rep. Tim Ryan (D., Warren) launched a new ad Friday in his campaign for U.S. Senate that highlighted some of the leading talking points he’s brought with him on the road across Ohio.
“Tim has a proven track record of taking on both parties to oppose bad trade deals, and working to bring down health care costs and put money back in the hands of working families.

“We have to be Americans first.”
In the ad, he also said that the key to curbing inflation is to bring back American jobs, especially from China, to fix the supply chain.
He is running for U.S. Senate to rebuild the middle class and create even more opportunities for workers,” his campaign wrote in a statement on the ad’s release.
Vance, former state treasurer Josh Mandel, investment banker Mike Gibbons, state Sen. Matt Dolan of Chagrin Falls, and businessmen Neil Patel and Mark Pukita.
The nominee will face one of seven Republicans seeking their party’s nomination in the Nov. 8 general election to succeed retiring U.S. Sen.
The entire TV ad buy is scheduled to run through May 17 in several Ohio markets, including Toledo, according to the Ryan campaign.
They are former Ohio Republican Party Chairman Jane Timken, author and venture capitalist J.D.
“We cannot afford to be Democrats and Republicans right now,” Mr. Ryan said in the ad.
“We’ve got to get serious about lowering costs and actually helping people,” he said.
The new ad’s appearance coincided with Friday’s latest campaign filing deadline.
The Ryan campaign reported it raised $4.1 million in the first quarter of 2022.
Early voting for the Ohio primaries is under way.
